episodeTitle: The War Draws to a Close! Ringing Far and Wide, the Proud Fantasia
episodeTitleJapanese: 戦いの終焉！遠く響く誇り高き幻想曲（ファンタジア）
episodeTitleRomanized: Tatakai no Shūen! Tōku Hibiku Hokoritakai Fantajia
description: The 400-year war on Sky Island comes to an end as Luffy's final blow causes the Golden Bell to ring, its sound reaching all the way to Jaya. Enel survives and departs for the moon on his Ark Maxim. The Skypieans and Shandians celebrate together in unity, with Pagaya revealed to be alive and reuniting with Conis. The Straw Hats witness the beginning of a new era of peace on Sky Island.

events.title: Luffy's Final Blow Strikes the Golden Bell
events.description: Luffy delivers his decisive final attack to Enel, causing the golden ball attached to his arm to strike the massive Golden Bell. The impact creates a powerful ring that echoes across all of Sky Island and down to the Blue Sea.
events.significance: This moment marks the culmination of the Skypiea arc and fulfills the 400-year-old promise to ring the bell. It symbolizes the end of Enel's tyrannical rule and the war between Skypieans and Shandians.

events.title: The Golden Bell Rings for the First Time in 400 Years
events.description: The Golden Bell, silent for four centuries, rings with a magnificent sound that reverberates throughout Sky Island. The bell's chime represents the fulfillment of Calgara's promise to his friend Noland and symbolizes the end of the conflict between Skypieans and Shandians.
events.significance: This is one of the most significant moments in the Skypiea arc, representing the resolution of a 400-year-old conflict and the fulfillment of an ancient promise. The bell's ring reaches Mont Blanc Cricket on Jaya, proving that the City of Gold exists in the sky.

events.title: Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance Hear the Bell
events.description: On Jaya island far below, Mont Blanc Cricket and the Saruyama Brothers (Masira and Shoujou) hear the sound of the Golden Bell ringing from the sky. Cricket breaks down in tears as he realizes the City of Gold truly existed and was always in the sky, vindicating his ancestor Noland's story.
events.significance: This moment provides emotional closure to Cricket's storyline and proves that Noland was not a liar. It validates Cricket's lifelong search and his family's honor, showing that the City of Gold was real all along.

quotes.speaker: Mont Blanc Cricket
quotes.context: Cricket realizes Noland's story was true upon hearing the Golden Bell

events.title: Luffy's Shadow Appears on the Clouds
events.description: As the Golden Bell rings, a massive shadow of Luffy in a triumphant pose is projected onto the clouds above Jaya. Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance see this shadow and realize that Luffy and the Straw Hats are safe and victorious.
events.significance: This visual confirms to Cricket that the Straw Hats succeeded in their adventure to Sky Island and are celebrating their victory. It provides reassurance to their allies below and creates an iconic visual moment.

events.title: Pagaya Revealed to Be Alive
events.description: Pagaya, who was believed to have been killed by Enel's lightning attack, is revealed to have survived. He explains that he was blown into the White Sea and is now reuniting with his daughter Conis and the other citizens of Angel Island.
events.significance: This joyful reunion demonstrates that not all of Enel's victims perished, providing hope and relief. It shows the resilience of Sky Island's people and adds to the celebratory atmosphere of the war's end.

events.title: The 400-Year War Ends: Skypieans and Shandians Celebrate Together
events.description: The Skypieans and Shandians, who have been at war for 400 years, come together in celebration and peace. The two groups light a massive bonfire together, symbolizing the end of their conflict and the beginning of a new era of cooperation. Skypieans touch Vearth (earth) for the first time in generations.
events.significance: This is the ultimate resolution of the Skypiea arc's central conflict. The 400-year war that began when the Skypieans took the Shandians' homeland is finally resolved peacefully. It represents themes of reconciliation, understanding, and the end of generational conflict.

events.title: Wyper Smiles at the Celebration
events.description: Wyper, the fierce Shandian warrior who has dedicated his life to fighting the Skypieans and reclaiming his homeland, is shown smiling as he watches the celebration between the two peoples. This marks a significant emotional moment for the character.
events.significance: Wyper's smile represents his acceptance of peace and the fulfillment of his ancestors' dreams in a way he never expected. It shows his character growth and the genuine resolution of the conflict, as even the most militant warrior can find peace.

events.title: Enel Departs for the Moon on Ark Maxim
events.description: Having survived Luffy's assault, Enel regains consciousness and uses his lightning powers to restart the Ark Maxim. He departs Sky Island, heading toward what he calls 'Fairy Vearth' (the endless vearth), which is revealed to be the moon.
events.significance: This event sets up Enel's future story arc and introduces the mystery of the moon in One Piece lore. It shows that Enel, despite his defeat, maintains his godlike delusions and embarks on a new journey that will be explored in the cover story 'Enel's Great Space Operations.'

quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel declares his intention to travel to the moon

events.title: The Straw Hats Discuss Their Next Move
events.description: The Straw Hat crew discusses what to do next. Zoro points out they're still broke despite all their efforts. Usopp mentions he prefers collecting Dials over treasure. Nami suggests returning to the Going Merry, but Luffy and Usopp veto the idea, hinting at unfinished business.
events.significance: This conversation shows the crew's different priorities and sets up their continued exploration of Sky Island. It maintains the crew's characteristic dynamic and foreshadows that they still have discoveries to make before leaving.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro reminds the crew they haven't found any treasure

events.title: Skypieans Experience Earth for the First Time
events.description: The Skypieans, who have lived on clouds their entire lives, explore Upper Yard and touch real earth (Vearth) for the first time. They express wonder and joy at experiencing something so common to Blue Sea dwellers but precious to them.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the importance of Vearth to Sky Island's people and shows the newfound access they have now that peace has been achieved. It illustrates one of the key themes of the arc: what is worthless to some is priceless to others.

quotes.speaker: Mont Blanc Cricket
quotes.context: Cricket realizes Noland's story was true upon hearing the Golden Bell

quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel declares his intention to travel to the moon

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro reminds the crew they haven't found any treasure

themes.description: The episode centers on the fulfillment of the 400-year-old promise between Calgara and Noland. The ringing of the Golden Bell represents keeping faith across centuries and validates those who believed in the truth.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell's ring symbolizes truth prevailing over lies, faith being rewarded, and promises transcending time and death.

themes.description: After 400 years of conflict, the Skypieans and Shandians finally make peace. The episode shows how shared experiences and the end of tyranny can heal even the deepest wounds.
themes.symbolism: The bonfire celebration represents the two cultures coming together in warmth and light after centuries of darkness and division.

themes.description: Multiple characters pursue their dreams in this episode: Luffy achieves his goal of defeating Enel, Cricket's dream of vindicating his ancestor is realized, and Enel pursues his twisted dream of reaching 'Fairy Vearth.'
themes.symbolism: The shadow of Luffy on the clouds represents dreams reaching new heights and being visible to those who support them.

themes.description: The episode validates historical truth and legacy. Noland is proven truthful, the Shandians' history is acknowledged, and the Golden Bell's message continues to ring.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell itself is a symbol of history and truth that cannot be silenced forever.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's victory over Enel and the ringing of the Golden Bell cement his role as a liberator and someone who brings about positive change wherever he goes.
keyActions: Delivers the final blow that rings the Golden Bell
Creates the shadow on the clouds visible from Jaya
Discusses next moves with the crew

characterSpotlights.role: Defeated tyrant who moves on to new delusions
characterSpotlights.development: Despite his defeat, Enel maintains his god complex and departs for the moon, showing his inability to accept reality and his continued pursuit of power.
keyActions: Restarts Ark Maxim using his lightning powers

characterSpotlights.development: Cricket receives emotional closure as the ringing bell proves his ancestor Noland was truthful. His lifelong search and belief are validated.
keyActions: Hears the Golden Bell from Jaya
Sees Luffy's shadow on the clouds
Breaks down crying in relief and joy

characterSpotlights.development: Wyper, the fierce Shandian warrior, finally accepts peace and smiles at the celebration, showing character growth and the fulfillment of his people's dreams.
keyActions: Witnesses the celebration between Skypieans and Shandians
Smiles for the first time, accepting peace

characterSpotlights.development: Conis experiences the joy of being reunited with her father Pagaya and witnesses the beginning of a new era of peace on her homeland.
keyActions: Touches Vearth for the first time

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several emotional moments, particularly Cricket's reaction to hearing the bell and the celebration scenes between Skypieans and Shandians.
Additional scenes of Skypieans exploring and touching Vearth were added for emotional impact.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the conclusion of the main conflict of the Skypiea arc, which is one of the longest arcs in One Piece anime history.
The ending song 'Tsuki to Taiyo' (Moon and Sun) is particularly fitting for this episode, as it plays during Enel's departure to the moon.

sources.title: Tsuki to Taiyo - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Enel's journey to the moon sets up the cover story 'Enel's Great Space Operations,' which reveals important information about the ancient civilization that created the automata.

sources.title: Enel's Great Space Operations - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is one of the few times in the series where a major antagonist survives and departs on their own terms rather than being captured or killed.
The episode covers manga chapters 299 (pages 2-19) and 300 (pages 2-19).
